summary: This document is a correspondence from the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services to Detective Krauel of the Palm Beach Police Department, providing information regarding Jeffrey E. Epstein's concealed weapon license. It details the issuance and renewal history of the license, including the expiration date and the address associated with Epstein.

persons.name: Charles H. Bronson
persons.context: Charles H. Bronson is mentioned as the Commissioner of the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, overseeing the licensing division.

persons.name: Detective Krauel
persons.context: Detective Krauel is the recipient of the correspondence, requesting information about Epstein's concealed weapon license.

persons.name: Mary Kennedy
persons.context: Mary Kennedy is identified as the Chief of the Bureau of Support Services, signing the correspondence to Detective Krauel.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the subject of the correspondence, with details provided about his concealed weapon license.

connections.description: Detective Krauel is a detective in the Palm Beach Police Department, while Mary Kennedy is the Chief of the Bureau of Support Services at the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services.
Mary Kennedy, as Chief of the Bureau of Support Services, oversees the licensing information related to Jeffrey E. Epstein.

events.title: Issuance of Concealed Weapon License
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein's concealed weapon license was initially issued.

events.title: Renewal Notice Sent
events.description: A renewal notice for Epstein's concealed weapon license was sent to him.

events.title: License Expiration
events.description: Epstein's concealed weapon license expired due to non-renewal.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, FL 33480
keyFacts: Jeffrey E. Epstein's concealed weapon license was initially issued on March 29, 1991.
A renewal notice for Epstein's license was sent on December 9, 2004.
The license expired on March 30, 2005, due to non-renewal, but he had up to 6 months to renew it.
The original application for the license was destroyed in compliance with the Division's Records Retention Schedule.
The correspondence was sent from the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services to the Palm Beach Police Department.
